meanings.definition: Causing great physical or mental suffering
meanings.sent1: The tormenting pain in his back made it hard for him to walk.
meanings.sent2: The dark memories were tormenting her mind, making it difficult to focus.
meanings.sent3: The tormenting itch from the bug bite was driving him crazy.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain was tormenting the farmers, destroying their crops.
meanings.sent5: The tormenting fear of failure paralyzed her from taking any risks.

meanings.sent1: The constant tormenting by the bullies made him dread going to school.
meanings.sent2: The relentless tormenting from the noisy neighbors kept her up at night.
meanings.sent3: The playful tormenting between siblings often ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The tormenting of the paparazzi made the celebrity's life unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The persistent tormenting of telemarketers annoyed him to no end.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to experience severe physical or mental suffering
meanings.sent1: The thought of losing her job was tormenting her every night.
meanings.sent2: The guilt of his actions was tormenting him, leading to sleepless nights.
meanings.sent3: The kids were tormenting each other with scary stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody of the song tormented her soul with memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The relentless storm was tormenting the small town, causing widespread damage.
